main event: An observer reported seeing a round object with colored lights in Oklahoma City on 9 Jan 59.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a basketball and was in slow spiraling motion., The observer used 6 x 50 binoculars with a filter to view the object., The object was seen while looking at the sun, suggesting it might not be a sunspot due to its motion., It was concluded that the object could possibly be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon., The observation lasted for 2-3 minutes.
witness description: electronic technician working at a refinery
